content: quilts herself so surely she wasn t plucking the patterns out of thin air indeed montgomery writes about knitting a quilt in january 1914 when she s working on anne of the island she s starting a third quilt writing in her journal of a particular pattern bringing her fond memories of a quilt-knitting craze in her youth and all the patterns that were passed around - frustratingly failing to note the actual name i do suspect it is the one she repeatedly references in the novels at this time - the apple leaf aside montgomery notes here that knitting always has had a good effect on me when i am nervous indicating that it helped her through the bad days today we often talk about the positive impact knitting can have upon mental health so we see montgomery was already well aware of this i wonder if mrs lynde too who had to deal with her husband s ill health his death and her own uncertain future knitted to calm her nerves luck was recently with me in my search for the apple-leaf pattern i stumbled upon the ladies world new york may 1896 there in print is e e doran s apple leaf bedspread in 1893 eighteen-year-old montgomery had a poem the violet s spell accepted in the ladies world for which she received two subscriptions it was obviously a magazine in her orbit during her youth though she thought it third rate and gave her spare subscription to her grandmother could this be the pattern though that inspired her as it turns out the main elements of the apple-leaf design were everywhere it was an early viral design the pattern in the ladies world also crops up in the canadian publication home work 1891 and again in the australian publication the dawn 1898 there are other versions besides and variations galore some of these such as australian town and country journal s 1913 square for quilt in apple-leaf pattern identify as apple but often the squares have other names as in weldon s 1891 open bay-leaf pattern for quilt square this makes sense in an era when patterns were simply passed along between knitters new variations and names evolving aside the l m montgomery institute holds a white afghan knitted by montgomery featuring a central four-leaf motif item f 6-4-1 we don t know when she knitted it alas but the appearance of that central motif confirms she was familiar with variations of the apple leaf - and yes that this may have been the apple-leaf pattern she meant all along and it s different to my guess but one i found out about this after i d almost finished my quilt and two she may have knitted more than one apple-leaf design when all is said and done and i don t even know if this one had been called apple-leaf i m still digging for more information but vintagekathleen blogged a version of it as
